title: Lenovo Tab V7 4 GB RAM 64 GB ROM 6.93 inch with Wi-Fi+4G Tablet (Onyx Black)

product_specification.Sales Package: Travel Adapter(Vv/2A), USB Cable, Quick-start guide, Warranty
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 year manufacturer warranty for Phone and 6 months warranty for in the box accessories

product_description.Stylish and Portable: This tablet’s design combines the beauty of a smartphone’s portability and a tablet’s screen (17.52 cm). This device can be carried around anywhere, thereby letting you watch your favourite shows on a much bigger screen.
product_description.Secure Login: You can unlock this tablet in two ways - you can open it using the fingerprint reader located in the back or unlock it via the face recognition feature.
product_description.Crystal-clear Sound: You can have your dose of entertainment any time of the day with this tablet in your hand. It features two built-in speakers in the front and it is enhanced with Dolby Audio for an enhanced aural experience.
product_description.Front and Back Cameras: This tablet features a 13 MP rear camera with multiple modes (HDR, Panorama, and Night Shot) to help you click clear images. It also features a 5 MP front camera, which supports Bokeh, to let you click beautiful selfies anywhere, anytime.
product_description.Battery: This tablet will help you power through the day, thanks to its powerful 5180 mAh battery.
product_description.Other Features: This tablet comes with dual SIM card slots. It also comes with 64 GB of internal memory (expandable by up to 128 GB) to let you store all your games and folders in one place. With 4 GB of RAM and the Qualcomm octa-core 450 processor in place, this tablet will facilitate a lag-free experience. What's more, you can enjoy seamless connectivity as this tab supports WiFi and 4G connections.

review: I cant call this a tab, its more like a phone similer to the previous lenovo phab 2 varients. Anyway I will start with the cons. 1. The camera is very average. Making a quality video is impossible. Frame rate is below average. 2. We can replace the bottom navigation bar with new gesture navigation, but it appears as an annoying little mark at the bottom. It does not have the option to hide it. Apart from these, the device is awesome. The first thing is its big display, which gives a premium experience in gaming and watching videos. Second best thing (and probably the best) is its battery. The gigantic 5100 mah battery makes my day. You wont believe that I didnt charge this device for 2 whole days of continuous usage of internet. The 4 gb ram and 64 gb internal memory makes multitasking super easy. The fingerprint scanning is super fast, better than my Samsung a20. In my opinion, if you are looking for a mid range utility phone, this is the one.

Sadly a good number of Phablet models have not been circulated in india (Mi Max 3, Oukitel K9, Honor 8x Max, Y Max) however Lenovo's got you covered.

This comes at a price, which is a low performance chipset, the SD450. But thanks to it, the battery consumption is very slow and the battery also charges very fast (90% in 2hrs) without QuickCharge feature. No comments on games because I have not bought this to play games, but solitaire works awesome.

My general purpose is watching youtube/anime, reading manga and thanks to the phone's size everything is a breeze. With minimal use my battery lasts for 4 days. 1.5 days for heavy use.

Do not believe other comments, VOLTE IS supported on this Set on SIM 1. Voice calling on JIO is possible. However the feature is listed as "HD" on the status bar, so might be misleading.

The phone has very little bloatware (mostly stock AOSP android pie), but because of this some level of customization will require root. There are no custom ROMs for this phone.

The camera is not the best, but this is not an issue as I bought a phone, not a camera.

First of all lenovo does not provided any screen protector or back cover. Not even a thin film has been pasted! This is utter unprofessional! And you will not able to buy it from open market even! So clearly you couldn't able to use the phone naturally.
The processor is just vintage! Lags a lot! Display is so so. Brightness level is not optimized. Camera are decent as it's a tab! But it's a phablet. The display of Previous phablets were much better than this! And it's overpriced! Not a recomended purchase.

I am using this phone for past 10 days. It is very good smart phone at this price point. Pretty decent camera resolution front and rear. Very comfortable for video calling and viewing experience. I watched many movies in online through this device. The jio sim runs very well in this phone. The 4gb and 64gb varient is highly helpful to store apps and other activities. The touch responsive is too good and smooth as butter. The battery backup is almost more than a day I should say. The 6.95 inch...

The only reason for buying this device is the 18:9 aspect ratio screen which is almost 7 inch in size much better than the narrow and taller aspect ratio devices flooding the market lately. There is absolutely no notch so a perfect rectangular screen. Screen brightness is a bit low, so does not look lively. Image quality from both the cameras is obviously disappointing. Battery life is good (not excellent) but the weight of this device is surprisingly light and very evenly balanced. I only wish that it came with a screen protector and a transparent silicon back cover, hope Lenovo is listening to this loud and clear. After market accessories for this device is non-existent. I like the type-C port but miss NFC and Bluetooth v5 (this one is Bluetooth v4.2). Processing speed is average, I see lags even while scrolling through SMSes and I only have saved a few hundreds The sotware is fantastic, no bloatware except apps like Skype and Netflix which I use. In fact, it feels bare-bones, I can't even find an option to swap the Menu and Back soft on-screen buttons 🤔. Very sober looking, not like the gradient flashy back that you see on other recent launches. I wish there was an 6GB RAM / 128GB storage version priced under 16k to really make a good value. So I write this review with mixed emotions. Obviously this is the best specs device for such a large screen but somehow feels extremely underwhelming. Go for it only if you are absolutely absolutely sure what you are getting into. In terms of the unique form-factor, it stands 2nd to none.

I finally got a huge phone of 4/64 gb variant. I like its amazing sound quality. Display is ok, neither good nor bad. Processor is ok though it is old. Now, it has android 9. I don't know when android 10 will receive!. Battery back up is very good. I found some cons in this phone which includes missing of auto call recording and dual apps. If Lenovo gives regular software updates in this phone, it will be very good. Inspite of huge battery, phone is very light when it holds in hand.

Value for Money Deal !

Why to Buy it -
1 ) Bigger screen - Great for Reading,Browsing, checking mails and entertainment.
2) Better Battery - Even after moderate to high usage the battery lasts for a day and a half!
3) Value for Money - Point 1 +2 +4gb RAM + Octa core SD processor + Dual 4g Volte sim at a price point of 10k is absolutely paisa vasool deal!

Why not to buy it
1) Camera is outdated
2) Despite of “Dolby” tag the speakers are very ordinary
3) Charging is very slow

Verdict - If need a phone cum tab for reading/browsing/watching video then this tabs comes very handy. Also the battery back is amazing and you will not require a powerbank at all.
Rest everything is mediocre about this tablet !

I thought extremely hard for three weeks before buying this phablet. After reading reviews on the net i nearly decided against purchasing it. The complaints were about its 'monstrous size of 6.9 inches', slow 1.8 GHz Snapdragon Processor and weak camera.

But i finally bought it because although those complaints were valid, they didn't matter in the least to me for my day to day usage requirements.

Here are the positives :

1. I love the monstrous size. It is huge but not unwieldy like a tablet. In fact, it will fit into any normal pant or coat pocket with ease.
2. The resolution of the screen is very good and pixles are invisible until you strain your eyes really hard to see them.
3. The UI is slick and smooth and even multitasking is fast. The snapdragon 450 doesn't feel strained by any measure.
4. The build quality is excellent.
5. The 4GB/64GB combo with 128GB SD Card added is more than enough for all my needs.
6. The 5180 MAh Battery lasts for two days with normal use interpersed by video and gaming sessions.
7. The rear Camera takes above average quality shots in light and dark conditions. It is definitely not pro oriented. The front camera is acceptable and the Bokeh effect is a plus.
8. The fingerprint reader is very accurate.

Here are the negatives :

1. The Camera setup could have been better but lenovo had to think about the price of the product.
2. The face recognition is a bit finicky.
3. The battery needs a long time to charge completely.

All in all, it is an exceptional product at a bargain price.

Beware of a few things

1. no Jio video calls and
2. no secondary noise cancellation.

This review is based on 1 week usage. I prefer Lenovo tab for close to stock experience. After juxtaposing Tabv7 vs Tab4 8 plus, decided to select v7 4GB/64GB as its 2 year recent release. Trade off is v7 having 450 chipset while 8 plus has 625; both snapdragon.

The prime purpose of the tablet is browsing and movies with no gaming. Out of the box the tablet has Android 9 that is followed by 2 updates that was a good impression. However, observing fractional lag initially while opening apps and that make my recommendation for 4GB RAM model over 3GB. Color production, battery backup, call quality, speaker volume, apps compatibility offers no issue but a quantitative update will be posted in a while.

Flipkart paking was horrendous, the main box was damaged from one side, fortunately with no visible harm to inside tablet box. The manufacturing date shows July-2019. Checking warranty status on Lenovo website shows product was already activated with warranty 8 months before my purchase. Not good. Advice to all buyers to check manufacturing date of any product that is purchased to avoid unpleasant surprises.

Got this for my mom and she loved it. The large display allows her to navigate through the apps and tabs effortlessly. At the same time, it's not too large and bulky to carry. Camera quality is okay given the price range. The best part is that the tab supports voice calling and VoLTE, which wasn't supported by my mom's older tab. I'd highly recommend this tab for anyone who's looking to gift it to their parents/grandparents.

At first, I was a little apprehensive about purchasing this as I hadn't owned such a big mobile before, but this monster came as a pleasant surprise!

Though it's a big mobile, once you get used to it, you will feel that it's very practical and user friendly.

Here is my review -

Pros -

1. The build is really great. Looks good. Good grip from the back and it feels more premium than many mid-range phones with glossy finish.

2. Big screen is awesome. No notch to ruin your experience. It plays beautiful 1080p videos. Text is big and clear. Great experience while reading mails, pdfs and browsing

3. Touch sensitivity is really nice. I have used sAMOLED screens in the past and it's a similar experience

4. Battery life is great. After a day of heavy usage, there is still some juice left

5. Notification LED

6. Fingerprint reader is really fast. Face recognition is not best but not bad either

7. Sound quality is excellent! Surround sound with some base. You can feel different sounds very clearly and great experience while playing pubg and video watching

8. 4g call quality and clarity is excellent. This is one of the best clarity I heard in a phone. plus speaker output is awesome.

9. Stock android is another best selling point of this phone. Though it has not so powerful processor but my experience has been mostly fluid and without lags

Cons -

1. As someone pointed out, certain software features are missing on the like display remains on while you are reading

2. You can play games but at medium to low graphic settings for smooth experience

3. YouTube app has a minor issue where the navigation buttons appear while watching video even without touching (but if you open YouTube via chrome this problem goes away. Netflix and prime experience really good with such a good quality screen)

4. Camera setup could have been better but still rear camera does a good job

5. Charging takes long time

overall it is a quality product and if you are looking for something new and interesting, go for it
